ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's mandatory
A case study type class on chemistry ethics. I would recommend it to another student, because it is important to know, it is a good class and because they have to take it.
1 month long 50 minutes a week ethics lecture on famous instances of plagarism, forging data, etc. and how to avoid it in real life.
The course presented the ethical conduct of research, going over behavior that was unethical and that was ethical. It provided an overview of how research ethics developed.

An introduction to principles and techniques of ethical reasoning, in a context pertaining to scientific research. Recommended for anyone who plans to conform to a professional standard of conduct in their work, which is to say everyone.
Enjoyable.
This course is compulsory.
Few lectures about ethics in science.Yes, it's required.
Sure, very help for doing research in the future
Yes I would recommend this course
Yes, I recommend this course.
yes, useful as a career guide for a phd student.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: How to ethically conduct research. Very appropriate.
Some interesting facts and stories, did learn some things but overall most of it just boiled down to basic ethical principles we've learned before.
It helped me to think more about chemistry ethics issues that I hadn't before considered in chemistry, in particular ones that aren't clear cut, and what I would do in those situations.

I was well-versed in current events in scientific ethics before the class already, but still I found out a lot of interesting history and how to avoid doing anything nefarious. It has taught me that my research is about the science, not my ego.
It provided an understanding of the ethics of research. It will be useful for my research.
This course enlarge my knowledge quite a lot. It definitely will help my research in the future.

There were several interesting cases of ethical misconduct that I hadn't heard about previously, so it did contribute to my knowledge about what has occurred in the field(and in other fields). The example about the person who hid fossils and artifacts was particularly fascinating.
Very helpful in learning about what will come up in ethics in research.
help a lot.
It helped me substantially
This class provides a platform for how to conduct research in a serious manner. It provided me with information on how to better myself as a scientist
Ethics is a very important subject and I think it is our responsibility to bear this in mind. This course successfully highlighted this point and is helpful to my future research.
